intro: Scorzonera circumflexa, commonly known as the bent-thistle, is a perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, spiny stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers with a distinctive, recurved shape, and its roots are often thick and fleshy. Scorzonera circumflexa is typically found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in arid environments. It is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance.
